column2: NEW YORK DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Amber lights are used on:
column4: personal vehicles driven by volunteer firefighters.
column6: authorized emergency vehicles.
column8: hazard vehicles.

column2: 2. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 3. How far before a turn must you signal?
column4: 500 feet
column6: 100 feet
column8: 50 feet

column2: 4. Drivers of vehicles that display blue, green or amber lights:
column4: can legally exceed the speed limit.
column6: are free to go the wrong way when responding to an emergency.
column8: must obey all traffic laws.

column2: 5. To drink an alcoholic beverage in a motor vehicle on a public highway, street or road is:
column4: a traffic infraction for a driver, but not for a passenger.
column6: a criminal violation for a driver or passenger.
column8: a misdemeanor for a driver, but not for a passenger.
column10: a traffic infraction for a driver or passenger.

column2: 6. This warning sign:
column4: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column6: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 7. Which of the following is NOT a guideline for driving at night:
column4: Use high beams when you are within 100 feet of the vehicle ahead.
column6: If you are leaving a brightly lit place, drive slowly until your eyes adjust to the darkness.
column8: Use headlights between the hours of sunset and sunrise.
column10: Don’t look directly at oncoming headlights.

column2: 8. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Pedestrians may turn right.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 9. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in a crosswalk.
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a tunnel.

column2: 10. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 11. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 12. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 13. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: change lanes.
column8: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column10: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 14. If no limit is posted, drive no more than:
column4: 55 MPH.
column6: 65 MPH.
column8: the unposted speed limit.

column2: 15. New York State requires seat belt use:
column4: by passengers 16 or older.
column6: by adults, and seat belts, booster seats or child safety seats for children.
column8: by the driver and front-seat passengers under 16.

column2: 16. With conventional brakes, the correct way to stop in an emergency situation where traction is lost and the car slides is:
column4: the ASB System.
column6: by pumping the brakes.
column8: the Anti-Slide System (ASS).

column2: 17. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column6: Brake lightly.
column8: Use your ABS System.

column2: 18. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: delay near it.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 19. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column6: Move to the left
column8: Slow down

column2: 20. You can not make a U-turn near the top of a hill or another location where other drivers can not see your vehicle from ___ feet away in either direction.
